thread.title: Wales lose but make finals with Belgium and Italy
thread.title_full: Wales lose but make finals with Belgium and Italy

title: Wales lose but make finals with Belgium and Italy
text:
LONDON | By Mike Collett Football - Bosnia & Herzegovina v Wales - UEFA Euro 2016 Qualifying Group B - Stadion Bilino Polje, Zenica, Bosnia & Herzegovina - 10/10/15Wales manager Chris Coleman is held up by his players as they celebrate after qualifying for UEFA Euro 2016Action Images via Reuters /... left 1 of 9 right Football - Bosnia & Herzegovina v Wales - UEFA Euro 2016 Qualifying Group B - Stadion Bilino Polje, Zenica, Bosnia & Herzegovina - 10/10/15Wales celebrate after qualifying for UEFA Euro 2016Action Images via Reuters / Matthew Childs left 2 of 9 right Bosnia's Senad Lulic (R) fights for the ball with Wales' Gareth Bale (C) during their Euro 2016 qualifying soccer match in Zenica October 10, 2015. Reuters/Dado Ruvic 3 of 9 right Football - Bosnia & Herzegovina v Wales - UEFA Euro 2016 Qualifying Group B - Stadion Bilino Polje, Zenica, Bosnia & Herzegovina - 10/10/15Bosnia & Herzegovina's Milan Djuric celebrates with team mates after scoring their first goalAction Images via Reuters / Matthew Childs left 4 of 9 right Belgium's Laurent Depoitre (2nd R) scores a goal against Andorra's goalkeeper Ferran Pol during their Euro 2016 Group B qualifying soccer match at Estadi Nacional stadium in Andorra la Vella, Andorra, October 10, 2015. Reuters/Albert Gea 5 of 9 right Belgium's players celebrate qualifying for Euro 2016 after defeating Andorra in their Group B qualifying soccer match at Estadi Nacional stadium in Andorra la Vella, Andorra, October 10, 2015. Reuters/Albert Gea 6 of 9 right Players of the Netherlands celebrate a goal scored by Georginio Wijnaldum during their Euro 2016 group A qualifying soccer match against Kazakhstan at the Astana Arena stadium in Astana, Kazakhstan, October 10, 2015. Reuters/Shamil Zhumatov 7 of 9 right Turkey's Arda Turan (L) jumps for the ball during the Euro 2016 group A qualification soccer match against Czech Republic in Prague, Czech Republic October 10, 2015. Reuters/David W Cerny 8 of 9 right Norway's Alexander Tettey (L) scores against Malta's goalkeeper Andrew Hogg (C) and defender Zach Muscat during their Euro 2016 qualifying soccer match in Ullevaal Stadium in Oslo, October 10, 2015. Reuters/Cornelius Poppe/NTB Scanpix 9 of 9 right 
LONDON Wales reached their first major tournament for 57 years despite losing 2-0 to Bosnia in their penultimate Euro 2016 Group B qualifying match on Saturday. 
Belgium also qualified for the finals in France next year as they leapfrogged Wales into first place at the top of the group with a 4-1 win in Andorra while Italy went through after their 3-1 win in a Group H match in Azerbaijan. 
Despite the defeat, Wales qualified because Israel lost 2-1 at home to Cyprus and, mathematically were the only team who could have prevented them finishing in the top two. 
Belgium top Group B with 20 points, followed by Wales on 18, Bosnia 14, Israel 13 and Cyprus 12. 
With one round of qualifiers remaining, the Netherlands, Turkey, Bosnia, Israel, Cyprus, Norway and Croatia ended the day either in contention for second place in their groups or a playoff berth after their final matches on Tuesday. 
While Wales, Belgium and Italy all made sure of their places in France, the Netherlands, who have not missed a championship finals since 1984, kept their chances of a playoff berth alive with a 2-1 win in Kazakhstan. 
The fate of the 1988 European champions will be decided on Tuesday when they face the already-qualified Czech Republic and Turkey, also vying for third place, play Iceland who have already sealed their spot. 
Turkey kept alive their hopes of third place in Group A with a 2-0 away win over the Czechs. 
Iceland, who drew 2-2 with Latvia on Saturday, and the Czechs fill the top two spots with 20 and 19 points respectively with Turkey on 15 and the Dutch on 13. 
The tussle for who qualifies with Italy from Group H is going to the wire after Norway beat Malta 2-0 and Croatia beat Bulgaria 3-0. 
Italy are secure with 21 points, Norway have 19 and Croatia 17. Norway play in Italy on Tuesday while Croatia travel to Malta.
